title: You know what will happen IF Rylais becomes a Mana/CDR item?
body:
It will totally be built over {{item:3165}}  100% of the time.
Why need some situational GW effect when you'll be SLOWING all the time, not giving up damage for the utility and also getting some of the best stats a mage would want?

Isn't that kinda counter intuitive?
The prime abuse cases are burst mages building the item, usually having to rely on ONE rotation to kill and they wouldn't usually need slows as most of them even have hard cc.
Giving them an easy access to Mana/CDR/AP as well as a huge slow would make them even more oppressive as they'd just rush rylais regardless.


Rylais should be a conscious option.
You should go; Hmm, I really want the slows to kite better and help my team beyond my standard kit, rather than; It gives a ton of Ap, i'll just buy it.


Most complaints about Rylais stem from champions who would not need it/want it if it had low AP buying it regardless?
{{champion:134}} is buying it as well, a champion who wouldn't even need the slows but she's doing so because it's a big ticket damage item with a great passive slow that makes it so much easier to get said damage off

I feel Riot has a bit of a warped idea of WHO should be buying the item and WHEN.
The changes they might do would just shift it into being a staple rush item on ANY mage instead of making it an option like it should have been before.

replies.body:
I actually think them changing it into this kind of item would create a lot more balance issues.
Not only won't it stop the current abusers to get hit by the change (Burst mages and co.) but it will open it up to an even greater demographic of champions who should never be able to get reliable slows in their kit.
{{champion:105}} Think about the perma slowing W
{{champion:38}} He'll be even more sticky and he really loves mana and CDR
{{champion:13}} Same as the others
{{champion:7}} Do I really have to go on?

These will be added to the pool of champions who will rush the hell out of that iteration of Rylais while also making the champions who were SUPPOSED to build it a balance nightmare.

I can see no real benefit from this approach, personal bias aside.

I have to agree on this. Shifting stats to favor champions that abuse it currently will only worsen the problem - while making the item an unattractive purchases to champions who actually need it like Mordekaiser and Vladimir.

Stop making it give more health than tank items. 

Jesus, people it shouldn't give more health than most tank items.

Frozen Mallet does even before the latest change. What's your issue? 

Tanks are high resists, not high health, according to Riot. The problem with tanks is their lack of actually combat-useful passives/actives that don't get nerfed to complete shit. That, and penetration honestly being too strong on both damage types. Oh, and Fiora/Vayne becoming meta any time tanks are decent.
70 AP and 500 hp more to your liking?
Why would a mid laner item give 40 ap to begin with like wtf?

It should not be an item that every mage and their counterpart buys. It should just be on mages that like to brawl. I hate playing against Ahri or insert high damage mage here, and them getting a whole wack of health, with a huge amount of ap, making it nigh impossible to avoid their damage, and if successfully doing so, they have too much hp and can survive a combo and a half.
So what mid laner of merit buys an Athene's?

Lux, Lulu, and Karma (maybe Sona, too?) are all decent mid laners.
Athene's is a strong utility item, and most mid laners will not buy it, but if you lost lane or want more utility over damage, Athene's is a valid option.

Just because you can imagine that champion in the support role while they're in the mid lane, doesn't mean they should be building Athene's while in the mid lane.

The correct answer is: The item doesn't give enough ap to be worth the purchase. No mid laner builds Athene's unless you're playing someone bad enough to let you get away with it.

The reason people take Morello's and not Athene's isn't the AP amount, even thought that is part of it, it's because why would you take an item like that, over morello's? you wouldn't, as both morello's and abbysal give you better more worthwhile stats than athene's. also the grievous wounds is a thing.
You basically said "The ap isn't it...although it is". -_-

Where the hell did i mention Athenes? Athene's has absolutely nothing to do with what I am saying.I'm saying champions like Ahri, should not have a 40% slow from an item that has 500 hp and get zero punishment damage wise.
Because you think a 40 ap item is good in the mid lane.

What? Where did i say that? I said Rylais should have a trade off for the utility and defensive stats it gives, and currently it does not. I also pointed out, it should not be a staple item on all mages. It never was until they buffed the ap on it massively. I still don't know what this has to do with Athene's.

Here's the deal: This comment chain's little tangent started where I was replying to MM about the initial change this guy suggested about making Rylai's 40 ap, because that's stupid. In the context of this chain, what you said made it seem as if you were defending Rylai's being a 40 ap item. My point was that Athene's *was* a mid lane item, but at 40 ap, it isn't worth buying, and Rylai's will be the same way at 40 ap.

Rylais AP i think should be between 65-75. I Don't think anything lower would be good, and I think anything higher is too much. As for Athene's, i don't know why the lowered the ap so much, but it could use a look, and probably a near complete rework.

60 would be fine, seeing how there's no 65/75 ap item. They nerfed Athene's into a crater because it's a support item now. However, it gives too much cdr. 20 ap and 10% cdr would make sense because support is overloaded with cdr atm.
I think Athene's could do something different, but I don't really have an idea on what would be appropriate.
Yes.
It's very similar to the state it was back when it was a niche item with 80 AP and 500 hp

Cause gold efficiency + it's the only viable trade off if you want to take 50~60 AP from the item.. otherwise you'll be taking away to much leave the item useless and no one would buy it.

_______________

In your defense tho, I really thing all Tank items need buffs.
Ehhh I think your proposed changes with 650 health and 40 AP would absolutely gut Vladimir. He depends on that slow to do jack shit.
O.o vlad is suposed to be able to build health items without regret. if this kills Vlad that's a Vlad kit balance problem.

Nope, Riot's made it **very** clear they don't like tank Vladimir, ergo the nerfing of health ratios and the benefits of buying it on his passive and the increase AP to health exchange and boosted AP ratios. He is now supposed to build AP items that have some tank stats on the side. He is no longer supposed to build health over AP.

Part of it is certainly a Vladimir balance issue, but part of it is the item has too much AP. Perhaps revert it to its original state, which was 80 AP, 500 health, and it was 3000 gold or so. This will discourage mid laners from buying it but won't punish the AP juggernauts as much.

not HP over AP,  but a huge chunck of HP With some AP tacked on.
not tank Vlad, bruiser Vlad.

I agree it's supposed to be bruiser build, but the thing is, with Vladimir you're supposed to build a combination. The only item other than boots that has no AP that I see most Vladimirs buy is Spirit Visage, and that's because the passive, MR, CDR, and health make it worth it.

You're not supposed to build HP over AP, and having only 40 or so AP on an item is precisely the definition of HP over AP. Even with Vladimir's passive, you only end up getting maybe 55 AP on the item. The previous version of Rylai's would work far better for all involved compared to the changes Riot's proposed. As Vladimir, you're supposed to mostly buy items that have AP and then some tank stats on them, such as Abyssal, Zhonya's, Rylai's, Liandry's, Protobelt, etc.

If Riot intended for Vladimir to build around 4000 health, they wouldn't have nerfed his health ratios so much and increased his AP ratios. Reducing the AP on a core item to him so drastically would put him in a seriously bad spot based upon his current ratios and Vladimir would have to receive even further changes.
